meanings.definition: An act of assessing something or someone.
meanings.sent1: During the appraisal, the teacher evaluated the students' work.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent provided an appraisal of the house's value.
meanings.sent3: At the zoo, the monkeys seemed to be conducting an appraisal of the visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her appraisal of the situation was like a detective solving a mystery.
meanings.sent5: The appraisal of the painting was so detailed, it felt like looking through a magnifying glass.

meanings.definition: An expert estimate of the value or worth of something.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler's appraisal of the diamond ring confirmed its high value.
meanings.sent2: Before selling the antique vase, they sought an expert appraisal.
meanings.sent3: The cat made an appraisal of the shiny fishbowl, wondering if it was valuable.
meanings.sent4: His appraisal of her skills was as precise as a scientist measuring chemicals.
meanings.sent5: The appraisal of the rare stamp was so accurate, it felt like magic.

meanings.sent1: The company conducted an appraisal of the employee's performance.
meanings.sent2: The art gallery requested an appraisal of the newly acquired painting.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to give a funny appraisal of the cat's attempt to climb a tree.
meanings.sent4: Her appraisal of the novel's plot twist was like a judge delivering a verdict.
meanings.sent5: The appraisal of the athlete's skills was so clear, it was like watching a slow-motion replay.
